newsitem.title: UK: Easynet sees no takeover from Online talks.
newsitem.headline: Easynet sees no takeover from Online talks.

text.p: Easynet Group Plc said on Friday talks that it was holding with internet service company UK Online were not expected to result in a takeover of Easynet.

Easynet, the internet access provider floated in March on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM), said on Thursday it was in co-operation talks with UK Online that may lead to a merger or acquisition.

But the group clarified on Friday: "The talks referred to do not concern or envisage any offer being made for Easynet Group Plc by UK Online...nor would any transaction or arrangement arising from these talks comprise a reverse takeover of Easynet..."
No further details about the talks were immediately available.
Easynet, which has already secured a deal with Microsoft, saw its shares marked up a sharp 12p to 68.5p in pre-market trade.

Under its arrangement with Microsoft, Easynet will be one of the access providers recommended to users of Windows 95 software who want to be connected to the Internet. There are about 160 Internet service providers in Britain fighting for revenue in a market some industry analysts say will be worth almost one billion stg by the year 2000.
